com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.cql

Class BoundStatementBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.cql.StatementBuilder<BoundStatementBuilder,BoundStatement>
      • com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.cql.BoundStatementBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bindable<BoundStatementBuilder>, AccessibleById, AccessibleByIndex, AccessibleByName, Data, GettableById, GettableByIndex, GettableByName, SettableById<BoundStatementBuilder>, SettableByIndex<BoundStatementBuilder>, SettableByName<BoundStatementBuilder>

    @NotThreadSafe
public class BoundStatementBuilder
extends StatementBuilder<BoundStatementBuilder,BoundStatement>
implements Bindable<BoundStatementBuilder>
    A builder to create a bound statement.

    This class is mutable and not thread-safe.

      • setBytesUnsafe

        @NonNull
public BoundStatementBuilder setBytesUnsafe(int i,
                                                     ByteBuffer v)
        Description copied from interface: SettableByIndex
        Sets the raw binary representation of the ith value.

        This is primarily for internal use; you'll likely want to use one of the typed setters instead, to pass a higher-level Java representation.

        Specified by:
        setBytesUnsafe in interface SettableByIndex<BoundStatementBuilder>
        v - the raw value, or null to set the CQL value NULL. For performance reasons, this is the actual instance used internally. If pass in a buffer that you're going to modify elsewhere in your application, make sure to duplicate it beforehand. If you change the buffer's index or its contents in any way, further usage of this data will have unpredictable results.

      • getBytesUnsafe

        public ByteBuffer getBytesUnsafe(int i)
        Description copied from interface: GettableByIndex
        Returns the raw binary representation of the ith value.

        This is primarily for internal use; you'll likely want to use one of the typed getters instead, to get a higher-level Java representation.

        Specified by:
        getBytesUnsafe in interface GettableByIndex
        Returns:
        the raw value, or null if the CQL value is NULL. For performance reasons, this is the actual instance used internally. If you read data from the buffer, make sure to duplicate it beforehand, or only use relative methods. If you change the buffer's index or its contents in any way, any other getter invocation for this value will have unpredictable results.

      • codecRegistry

        @NonNull
public CodecRegistry codecRegistry()
        Description copied from interface: Data
        Returns the registry of all the codecs currently available to convert values for this instance.

        If you obtained this object from the driver, this will be set automatically. If you created it manually, or just deserialized it, it is set to CodecRegistry.DEFAULT. You can reattach this object to an existing driver instance to use its codec registry.

        Specified by:
        codecRegistry in interface Data
        See Also:
        Detachable

      • protocolVersion

        @NonNull
public ProtocolVersion protocolVersion()
        Description copied from interface: Data
        Returns the protocol version that is currently used to convert values for this instance.

        If you obtained this object from the driver, this will be set automatically. If you created it manually, or just deserialized it, it is set to ProtocolVersion.DEFAULT. You can reattach this object to an existing driver instance to use its protocol version.

        Specified by:
        protocolVersion in interface Data
        See Also:
        Detachable
